question: 1. A ray of light which strikes a glass slab from air at normal incidence passes through the slab
optionA: undeviated and undisplaced at a lower speed
optionB: deviated and undisplaced at a lower speed
optionC: deviated and displaced at a lower speed
optionD: undeviated and displaced at a faster speed
answer: undeviated and undisplaced at a lower speed

question: 2. A short chain is usually attached to the back of a petrol tanker and trailing behind it so that the
optionA: petrol tanker is balanced on the road
optionB: heat generated by friction in the engine can be conducted to the earth
optionC: charges generated by friction in the tanker are conducted to the earth
optionD: chain can produce sound in resonance with the noise from the tanker's engine
answer: charges generated by friction in the tanker are conducted to the earth
